ground_truth: Tommy and Kayleigh load popcorn and drinks onto Evan's lap as Lenny pushes the wheelchair. Evan celebrates his 14th birthday and blows out the candles. Evan screams as blood pours from his nose, and Lenny is out of bed at once to help him, as is Kayleigh. Evan sips from a beer cap as Lenny and Kayleigh make out in plain sight with Tommy's bashful approval. Evan is in agony as Kayleigh opens a series of dorm doors and Lenny rushes Evan's wheelchair through. Kayleigh carries a pair of prosthetic arms in her hands. Evan launches his body forward and spills clumsily out of the wheelchair. Evan focuses on Lenny, but it's hard to ignore the crowd that titters and snickers in the background. Kayleigh turns to face the jeering crowd, which then breaks up and leaves. Lenny and Kayleigh push Evan's wheelchair around the quad. Evan now wears prosthetic arms and looks up as they roll along, his eyes brightening when he sees Evan. Kayleigh looks at Evan, and he allows her to roll him away from the others. Kayleigh, now by a bench, stops and sits. As she casually uses her foot to turn his chair to face her, she pulls out a granola bar and hands it to him. His prosthetic hand crushes it, and it crumbles to dust. Kayleigh shakes her head sadly, then suddenly looks up. Evan turns to see Lenny waving her over. She puts her hand on Evan's shoulder, stands, and goes to Lenny. Evan can't take his eyes off her. He observes Lenny kissing Kayleigh and turns away, utterly heartbroken. Evan's stump turns on a bathtub faucet, and fully clothed, he lies in a bathtub that's filling with water. Beside the tub, the wheelchair has been tipped over. The water rises past his mouth to his nostrils, and Evan makes his peace and takes a final breath. The water spills over the side of the tub, and all Evan can do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose. Tommy enters, pushes a lever, and the mechanical wheelchair rolls itself out of the room. Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps tons of Evan's junk on the floor: old report cards, books, toys, and photo albums. Evan beams when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. Lenny, utterly baffled, sits back in silence and watches Evan begin reading his journal to himself for a beat. Evan comes to in his childhood kitchen, springs to his feet, and flexes his real hands triumphantly. He rummages through the utensil drawer, pulls out a large butcher knife, and tries to tuck it into his sock, but it won't fit.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh load popcorn and beverages onto Evan's lap as Lenny pushes the wheelchair. Evan commemorates his 14th birthday and blows out the candles. Evan yells as blood gushes from his nose, and Lenny is out of bed at once to assist him, as is Kayleigh. Evan sips from a beer cap as Lenny and Kayleigh make out in plain view with Tommy's bashful approval. Evan is in torment as Kayleigh opens a series of dormitory doors and Lenny rushes Evan's wheelchair through. Kayleigh carries a pair of artificial arms in her hands. Evan propels his body forward and falls awkwardly out of the wheelchair. Evan concentrates on Lenny, but it's hard to disregard the crowd that titters and snickers in the background. Kayleigh turns to face the mocking crowd, which then breaks up and departs. Lenny and Kayleigh push Evan's wheelchair around the quad. Evan now wears artificial arms and looks up as they roll along, his eyes brightening when he sees Evan. Kayleigh looks at Evan, and he permits her to roll him away from the others. Kayleigh, now by a bench, stops and sits. As she casually uses her foot to turn his chair to face her, she pulls out a granola bar and hands it to him. His artificial hand crushes it, and it crumbles to dust. Kayleigh shakes her head sadly, then suddenly looks up. Evan turns to see Lenny waving her over. She puts her hand on Evan's shoulder, stands, and goes to Lenny. Evan can't take his eyes off her. He observes Lenny kissing Kayleigh and turns away, utterly heartbroken. Evan's stump turns on a bathtub faucet, and fully clothed, he lies in a bathtub that's filling with liquid. Beside the tub, the wheelchair has been tipped over. The liquid rises past his mouth to his nostrils, and Evan makes his peace and takes a final breath. The liquid spills over the side of the tub, and all Evan can do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose. Tommy enters, pushes a lever, and the mechanical wheelchair rolls itself out of the chamber. Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps tons of Evan's junk on the floor: old report cards, volumes, toys, and photo albums. Evan beams when he sees Lenny holding his old diary. Lenny, utterly perplexed, sits back in silence and watches Evan begin reading his diary to himself for a beat. Evan comes to in his childhood kitchen, springs to his feet, and flexes his real hands triumphantly. He rummages through the utensil drawer, pulls out a large butcher knife, and tries to tuck it into his sock, but it won't fit.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Popcorn and drinks are loaded onto Evan's lap by Tommy and Kayleigh as the wheelchair is pushed by Lenny. Evan's 14th birthday is celebrated, and the candles are blown out by him. Blood pours from Evan's nose, and at once, he is helped by Lenny who jumps out of bed, as is Kayleigh. A sip from a beer cap is taken by Evan as Lenny and Kayleigh make out in plain sight with Tommy approving bashfully. Agony is experienced by Evan as a series of dorm doors are opened by Kayleigh and Lenny rushes his wheelchair through. A pair of prosthetic arms are carried in her hands by Kayleigh. Evan's body is launched forward by him, and he clumsily spills out of the wheelchair. Lenny is focused on by Evan, but it's hard for him to ignore the crowd that titters and snickers in the background. The jeering crowd is faced by Kayleigh, which then breaks up and leaves. Evan's wheelchair is pushed around the quad by Lenny and Kayleigh. Now, Evan wears prosthetic arms and his eyes brighten as he looks up, seeing Evan. At Evan, Kayleigh looks, and he allows her to roll him away from the others. By a bench, Kayleigh stops and sits. Casually, she uses her foot to turn his chair to face her and pulls out a granola bar to hand it to him. The granola bar is crushed by his prosthetic hand, and it crumbles to dust. Her head is shaken sadly by Kayleigh, then suddenly she looks up. Lenny is seen waving her over by Evan as he turns. Evan's shoulder is patted by her, she stands, and she goes to Lenny. Off her, Evan can't take his eyes. Lenny is observed by him kissing Kayleigh, and he turns away, utterly heartbroken. A bathtub faucet is turned on by Evan's stump, and, fully clothed, he lies in a bathtub that's filling with water. Beside the tub, his wheelchair is tipped over. The water rises past Evan's mouth to his nostrils, and peace is made by him as he takes a final breath. The side of the tub is spilled over by water, and all Evan can do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose. A lever is pushed by Tommy as he enters, and the room is exited by the mechanical wheelchair, rolling itself out. Lenny is watched eagerly by Evan as tons of Evan's junk are dumped on the floor: old report cards, books, toys, and photo albums. When Lenny is seen holding his old journal, Evan beams. Baffled utterly, Lenny sits back in silence and watches as Evan begins reading his journal to himself for a beat. In his childhood kitchen, Evan comes to, springs to his feet, and triumphantly flexes his real hands. Through the utensil drawer, he rummages, pulls out a large butcher knife, and tries to tuck it into his sock, but it won't fit.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh pile popcorn and drinks onto Evan’s lap as Lenny pushes the wheelchair. Evan celebrates his 14th birthday, blowing out the candles. Suddenly, he screams as blood pours from his nose; Lenny and Kayleigh rush to help. Evan sips from a beer cap while Lenny and Kayleigh kiss in front of Tommy, who shyly approves. Evan winces in pain as Kayleigh opens dorm doors and Lenny speeds his wheelchair through. Kayleigh holds prosthetic arms. Evan lunges forward, spilling from the chair. He focuses on Lenny, ignoring a mocking crowd. Kayleigh faces them, and they disperse. She and Lenny push Evan across the quad. Now wearing prosthetics, Evan’s eyes brighten when he sees Evan. Kayleigh looks at him, then rolls him away. Stopping by a bench, she uses her foot to turn him toward her, hands him a granola bar, which his prosthetic hand crushes. She shakes her head, then looks up as Lenny waves. She touches Evan’s shoulder and leaves. Evan watches Lenny kiss Kayleigh, turns away, heartbroken. In a tub, fully clothed, Evan turns on the faucet with his stump. The tipped-over wheelchair sits nearby. Water rises over his face, and he breathes peacefully. Tommy enters, pulls a lever, and Evan’s mechanical wheelchair exits. Evan watches Lenny dump old report cards, books, toys, and photo albums. He beams when Lenny holds up his journal. Lenny, confused, watches Evan read it silently. Evan awakens in his childhood kitchen, leaps up, flexing real hands. He grabs a butcher knife from the drawer and tries to tuck it into his sock, but it doesn’t fit.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh load snacks on Evan's lap as Lenny pushes the wheelchair. Evan celebrates his 14th birthday, blows out candles, then screams as blood pours from his nose. Lenny and Kayleigh rush to help. Evan sips from a beer cap while Lenny and Kayleigh kiss with Tommy's approval. In agony, Evan spills from his wheelchair as Kayleigh opens dorm doors and Lenny rushes him through. Kayleigh carries prosthetic arms. Evan focuses on Lenny, ignoring the snickering crowd. Kayleigh faces the crowd, which disperses. Lenny and Kayleigh push Evan around the quad. Evan, wearing prosthetic arms, brightens when he sees Evan. Kayleigh rolls him away, stops by a bench, and gives him a granola bar, which his prosthetic hand crushes. She looks up as Lenny waves her over, puts her hand on Evan's shoulder, and leaves. Evan watches, heartbroken, as Lenny kisses Kayleigh. Evan turns on a bathtub faucet, lies in the filling tub, and takes a final breath. Water spills over, and Tommy enters, pushing a lever to roll the wheelchair out. Evan watches Lenny dump his belongings, beams at his old journal, and begins reading. He comes to in his childhood kitchen, flexes his real hands, rummages for a butcher knife, and tries to tuck it into his sock.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh carefully load an assortment of popcorn and drinks onto Evan's lap, ensuring everything is balanced as Lenny diligently pushes the wheelchair forward. It is a special day for Evan, who is joyfully celebrating his 14th birthday. With excitement, he blows out the candles on his cake. Suddenly, Evan lets out a scream as blood begins to pour from his nose, prompting Lenny to leap out of bed immediately to assist him, with Kayleigh also rushing to his side. Evan takes a sip from a beer cap while Lenny and Kayleigh openly make out, much to Tommy's bashful approval. Evan is in visible agony as Kayleigh hurriedly opens a series of dormitory doors, allowing Lenny to swiftly push Evan's wheelchair through the passageways. In her hands, Kayleigh carries a pair of prosthetic arms. In a desperate attempt, Evan launches his body forward, clumsily spilling out of the wheelchair. Although Evan tries to focus on Lenny, it is difficult to ignore the crowd that titters and snickers in the background. Kayleigh turns to face the jeering crowd, which then disperses and leaves the scene. Lenny and Kayleigh continue to push Evan's wheelchair around the quad. Now equipped with prosthetic arms, Evan looks up as they roll along, his eyes brightening when he catches sight of Evan. Kayleigh glances at Evan, and he allows her to roll him away from the others. Once they reach a bench, Kayleigh stops and sits down. Casually using her foot, she turns his chair to face her and pulls out a granola bar, handing it to him. Unfortunately, his prosthetic hand crushes it, causing it to crumble into dust. Kayleigh shakes her head sadly, then suddenly looks up. Evan turns to see Lenny waving her over. She places her hand on Evan's shoulder, stands up, and walks over to Lenny. Evan can't take his eyes off her, watching intently as Lenny kisses Kayleigh, leaving Evan utterly heartbroken. In a moment of despair, Evan's stump turns on a bathtub faucet, and fully clothed, he lies down in a bathtub that is gradually filling with water. Beside the tub, the wheelchair has been tipped over. The water rises past his mouth to his nostrils, and Evan makes his peace, taking what he believes to be a final breath. The water spills over the side of the tub, and all Evan can do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose. Tommy enters the room, pushes a lever, and the mechanical wheelchair rolls itself out. Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps a large amount of Evan's belongings onto the floor: old report cards, books, toys, and photo albums. Evan beams with joy when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. Lenny, utterly baffled, sits back in silence and watches as Evan begins reading his journal to himself for a moment. Suddenly, Evan finds himself in his childhood kitchen, springs to his feet, and flexes his real hands triumphantly. He rummages through the utensil drawer, pulls out a large butcher knife, and attempts to tuck it into his sock, but it won't fit.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh carefully and meticulously load an assortment of various popcorn varieties and an array of drinks onto Evan's lap, ensuring that everything is perfectly balanced as Lenny diligently and attentively pushes the wheelchair forward with care. It is a particularly special day for Evan, who is joyfully and excitedly celebrating his 14th birthday. With an expression of excitement, he exuberantly blows out the candles on his birthday cake. Suddenly, Evan lets out a piercing scream as blood unexpectedly begins to pour from his nose, prompting Lenny to leap out of bed immediately to assist him, with Kayleigh also swiftly rushing to his side. Evan takes a sip from a beer cap while Lenny and Kayleigh openly make out, much to Tommy's bashful and slightly embarrassed approval. Evan is in visible and acute agony as Kayleigh hurriedly opens a series of dormitory doors, allowing Lenny to swiftly push Evan's wheelchair at a brisk pace through the passageways. In her hands, Kayleigh carries a pair of prosthetic arms. In a desperate attempt, Evan launches his body forward, clumsily spilling out of the wheelchair. Although Evan tries to focus intently on Lenny, it is difficult for him to ignore the crowd that titters and snickers in the background. Kayleigh turns to face the jeering crowd, which then disperses and leaves the scene. Lenny and Kayleigh continue to push Evan's wheelchair around the quad. Now equipped with prosthetic arms, Evan looks up as they roll along, his eyes brightening when he catches sight of Evan. Kayleigh glances at Evan, and he allows her to roll him away from the others. Once they reach a bench, Kayleigh stops and sits down. Casually using her foot, she turns his chair to face her and pulls out a granola bar, handing it to him. Unfortunately, his prosthetic hand crushes it, causing it to crumble into dust. Kayleigh shakes her head sadly, then suddenly looks up. Evan turns to see Lenny waving her over. She places her hand gently on Evan's shoulder, stands up, and walks over to Lenny. Evan can't take his eyes off her, watching intently as Lenny kisses Kayleigh, leaving Evan utterly and completely heartbroken. In a moment of despair, Evan's stump turns on a bathtub faucet, and fully clothed, he lies down in a bathtub that is gradually filling with water. Beside the tub, the wheelchair has been tipped over. The water rises past his mouth to his nostrils, and Evan makes his peace, taking what he believes to be a final breath. The water spills over the side of the tub, and all Evan can do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose. Tommy enters the room, pushes a lever, and the mechanical wheelchair rolls itself out. Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps a large amount of Evan's belongings onto the floor: old report cards, books, toys, and photo albums. Evan beams with joy when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. Lenny, utterly baffled, sits back in silence and watches as Evan begins reading his journal to himself for a moment. Suddenly, Evan finds himself in his childhood kitchen, springs to his feet, and flexes his real hands triumphantly. He rummages through the utensil drawer, pulls out a large butcher knife, and attempts to tuck it into his sock, but it won't fit.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh carefully balance popcorn and drinks, placing them onto Evan's lap with precision as Lenny steadily pushes the wheelchair forward. As they move, Evan, celebrating his 14th birthday, eagerly leans forward to blow out the candles on his cake, his face lighting up with joy. Suddenly, Evan lets out a scream as blood begins to pour from his nose, prompting Lenny to spring out of bed immediately to assist him, with Kayleigh quickly following suit. In a moment of levity, Evan takes a sip from a beer cap, while Lenny and Kayleigh, oblivious to their surroundings, engage in a public display of affection, which Tommy observes with a bashful nod of approval. Meanwhile, Evan is in visible agony as Kayleigh swiftly opens a series of dorm doors, allowing Lenny to rush Evan's wheelchair through the narrow passages. Kayleigh, holding a pair of prosthetic arms in her hands, watches as Evan, with a determined effort, launches his body forward, clumsily spilling out of the wheelchair. Despite his focus on Lenny, Evan finds it difficult to ignore the crowd that titters and snickers in the background. Kayleigh, sensing the tension, turns to face the jeering crowd, her gaze causing them to disperse and leave. Together, Lenny and Kayleigh push Evan's wheelchair around the quad, where Evan, now equipped with prosthetic arms, looks up with a sense of hope as they roll along, his eyes brightening at the sight of Evan. Kayleigh exchanges a glance with Evan, who consents to her rolling him away from the others. Once by a bench, Kayleigh stops and sits down, casually using her foot to turn Evan's chair to face her. She then pulls out a granola bar and hands it to him, only for his prosthetic hand to crush it into dust. Kayleigh shakes her head sadly at the mishap, but her attention is suddenly drawn upward. Evan turns to see Lenny waving her over, and she places a reassuring hand on Evan's shoulder before standing and walking over to Lenny. Evan's gaze remains fixed on her, unable to look away, as he watches Lenny kiss Kayleigh, prompting him to turn away, utterly heartbroken. In a moment of despair, Evan uses his stump to turn on a bathtub faucet and, fully clothed, lies down in the tub as it fills with water. The wheelchair beside the tub has been tipped over, and as the water rises past his mouth to his nostrils, Evan makes his peace and takes a final breath, watching the water spill over the side of the tub while still breathing easily through his nose. Tommy enters the scene, pushes a lever, and the mechanical wheelchair rolls itself out of the room. Evan's attention shifts to Lenny, who eagerly dumps a pile of Evan's belongings on the floor, including old report cards, books, toys, and photo albums. Evan's face lights up with a beam of recognition when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. Lenny, utterly baffled, sits back in silence, watching as Evan begins to read his journal to himself for a moment. Suddenly, Evan finds himself in his childhood kitchen, where he springs to his feet and triumphantly flexes his real hands. He rummages through the utensil drawer, pulls out a large butcher knife, and attempts to tuck it into his sock, only to find that it won't fit.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh load popcorn and drinks onto Evan's lap as Lenny pushes his wheelchair. During Evan's 14th birthday celebration, he blows out the candles but suddenly screams as blood pours from his nose, prompting Lenny and Kayleigh to rush to his aid. Later, Evan sips from a beer cap while Lenny and Kayleigh make out, with Tommy bashfully approving. In pain, Evan is rushed through a series of dorm doors by Lenny, with Kayleigh carrying prosthetic arms. Evan clumsily spills out of his wheelchair, focusing on Lenny despite the crowd's jeers. Kayleigh confronts the crowd, which disperses, and then she and Lenny push Evan around the quad. Now wearing prosthetic arms, Evan's eyes brighten as he sees Lenny. Kayleigh rolls him away from the others, stops by a bench, and hands him a granola bar, which his prosthetic hand crushes. She shakes her head sadly, then responds to Lenny's wave, leaving Evan heartbroken as he watches them kiss. In despair, Evan turns on a bathtub faucet, lies fully clothed in the filling tub, and makes peace as the water rises. Tommy enters, pushes a lever, and the mechanical wheelchair exits the room. Evan watches Lenny eagerly dump his old belongings, beaming when he sees his journal. Lenny, baffled, watches Evan read it. Evan suddenly finds himself in his childhood kitchen, triumphantly flexes his real hands, rummages through a drawer, and unsuccessfully tries to tuck a butcher knife into his sock.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh load popcorn and drinks onto Evan's lap as Lenny, who had been his best friend since elementary school, pushes the wheelchair. Evan celebrates his 14th birthday and blows out the candles on a cake crafted by his grandmother, known in the family for her delicious desserts. Suddenly, Evan screams as blood, a frequent occurrence due to a chronic condition known as hemophilia, pours from his nose, and Lenny is out of bed at once to help him, as is Kayleigh. Evan sips from a beer cap, a peculiar habit he picked up to manage anxiety, as Lenny and Kayleigh make out in plain sight with Tommy's bashful approval. Evan is in agony as Kayleigh opens a series of dorm doors at their local community college, and Lenny rushes Evan's wheelchair through. Kayleigh carries a pair of prosthetic arms in her hands, designed by a company specializing in assistive technology. Evan launches his body forward and spills clumsily out of the wheelchair, a reckless act he often attempted in defiance of his condition. Evan focuses intently on Lenny, but it's hard to ignore the crowd that titters and snickers in the background, typical behavior he had grown to despise in school hallways. Kayleigh turns to face the jeering crowd, which then breaks up and leaves, accustomed to her no-nonsense demeanor. Lenny and Kayleigh push Evan's wheelchair around the quad, a central meeting place at their campus. Evan now wears prosthetic arms, feeling a mix of shame and newfound freedom, and looks up as they roll along, his eyes brightening when he sees a familiar face, likely an old friend from middle school. Kayleigh looks at Evan, and he allows her to roll him away from the others, craving some privacy. Kayleigh, now by a bench used frequently by students for study sessions, stops and sits. As she casually uses her foot to turn his chair to face her, she pulls out a granola bar and hands it to him, something he often forgot to eat during his depression. His prosthetic hand crushes it, and it crumbles to dust, a frustrating reminder of his limitations. Kayleigh shakes her head sadly, then suddenly looks up. Evan turns to see Lenny waving her over from the spot where they often shared secrets. She puts her hand on Evan's shoulder, stands, and goes to Lenny. Evan can't take his eyes off her, as she was one of the few who understood him. He observes Lenny kissing Kayleigh and turns away, utterly heartbroken, remembering the time they were all inseparable. Evan's stump turns on a bathtub faucet, and fully clothed, he lies in a bathtub that's filling with water, a ritual that temporarily numbed his emotional pain. Beside the tub, the wheelchair has been tipped over, emblematic of his desire to abandon it entirely. The water rises past his mouth to his nostrils, and Evan makes his peace and takes a final breath, feeling a fleeting sense of calm. The water spills over the side of the tub, and all Evan can do is watch it, still breathing easily through his nose, as if waiting for an intervention. Tommy enters, pushes a lever, and the mechanical wheelchair, a gift from an organization for differently-abled youth, rolls itself out of the room. Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps tons of Evan's junk on the floor, including cherished items collected over his early childhood: old report cards, books, toys, and photo albums. Evan beams when he sees Lenny holding his old journal, which contained his deepest thoughts and dreams. Lenny, utterly baffled by the emotional weight of its contents, sits back in silence and watches Evan begin reading his journal to himself for a beat. Evan comes to in his childhood kitchen, a space filled with memories of family dinners, springs to his feet, and flexes his real hands triumphantly, realizing he must have been dreaming. He rummages through the utensil drawer, pulls out a large butcher knife, and tries to tuck it into his sock, but it won't fit, an act of rebellion that mirrored a recurring theme of facing challenges.

Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. She puts her hand on Evan's shoulder stands and goes to Lenny. Evan cannot take his eyes off her. He observes Lenny kissing Kayleigh and turns away utterly heartbroken. Evan's stump turns on a bathtub faucet and fully clothed. he lies in a bathtub that is filling with water. Beside the tub the wheelchair has been tipped over. The water rises past his mouth to his nostrils and Evan makes his peace and takes a final breath. The water spills over the side of the tub and all Evan can do is watch it still breathing easily through his nose. Tommy enters pushes a lever and the mechanical wheelchair rolls itself out of the room. Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps tons of Evan's junk on the floor. old report cards books toys and photo albums. Evan beams when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. Lenny utterly baffled sits back in silence and watches. Evan begin reading his journal to himself for a beat. Evan comes to in his childhood kitchen springs to his feet and flexes his real hands triumphantly. He rummages through the utensil drawer pulls out a large butcher knife and tries to tuck it into his sock but it will not fit.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh load popcorn and drinks onto Evan's lap as Lenny pushes the wheelchair. Evan celebrates his 14th birthday and blows out the candles. Evan screams as blood pours from his nose and Lenny is out of bed at once to help him as is Kayleigh. Evan sips from a beer cap as Lenny and Kayleigh make out in plain sight with Tommy's bashful approval. Evan is in agony as Kayleigh opens a series of dorm doors and Lenny rushes Evan's wheelchair through. Kayleigh carries a pair of prosthetic arms in her hands. Evan launches his body forward and spills clumsily out of the wheelchair. Evan focuses on Lenny but it is hard to ignore the crowd that titters and snickers in the background. Tommy enters pushes a lever and the mechanical wheelchair rolls itself out of the room. Evan watches Lenny eagerly as he dumps tons of Evan's junk on the floor. old report cards books toys and photo albums. Evan beams when he sees Lenny holding his old journal. Lenny utterly baffled sits back in silence and watches. Evan begin reading his journal to himself for a beat. Evan comes to in his childhood kitchen springs to his feet and flexes his real hands triumphantly. He rummages through the utensil drawer pulls out a large butcher knife and tries to tuck it into his sock but it will not fit.

Evan screams as blood pours from his nose and Lenny is out of bed at once to help him as is Kayleigh. Evan sips from a beer cap as Lenny and Kayleigh make out in plain sight with Tommy's bashful approval. Evan begin reading his journal to himself for a beat. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Bobby and Gina pack marshmallows and pencils onto Oliver's chair as Max tugs the scooter. Oliver enjoys his 75th anniversary and shakes the maracas. Oliver whispers as glitter spills from his ear, and Max is out of the tent immediately to dance with him, as is Gina. Oliver nibbles on a mug lid as Max and Gina jump in slow motion with Bobby's careful witnessing. Oliver is in bliss as Gina unlocks a string of closet windows and Max urges Oliver's scooter through. Gina holds a pair of rubber ducks in her arms. Oliver throws his body upward and falls effortlessly out of the scooter. Oliver concentrates on Max, but it's difficult to avoid the herd that giggles and chuckles in the distance. Gina spins to address the laughing herd, which then scatters and vanishes. Max and Gina nudge Oliver's scooter around the park. Oliver now sports rubber ducks and gazes up as they glide along, his vision brightening when he notices Oliver. Gina glances at Oliver, and he permits her to glide him away from the strangers. Gina, now beside a fountain, halts and perches. As she casually taps her toe to twist his chair to view her, she extracts a cookie and offers it to him. His rubber fingers squeeze it, and it crumbles to fragments. Gina nods ruefully, then unexpectedly glances upward. Oliver turns to notice Max calling her over. She places her hand on Oliver's elbow, rises, and strolls to Max. Oliver can't divert his glance from her. He witnesses Max hugging Gina and turns aside, profoundly shattered. Oliver's twig shifts on a sandwich toaster, and fully clothed, he reclines in a hammock that's filling with leaves. Beside the hammock, the scooter has been flipped over. The leaves flow past his chin to his eyebrows, and Oliver accepts his fate and inhales a decisive gulp. The leaves tumble over the rim of the hammock, and all Oliver can do is observe it, still inhaling comfortably through his ear. Bobby enters, tilts a switch, and the electric scooter trundles itself out of the space. Oliver observes Max expectantly as he scatters loads of Oliver's trinkets on the carpet: old letters, sculptures, crayons, and scrapbooks. Oliver glows when he sees Max clutching his ancient diary. Max, entirely perplexed, reclines back in silence and observes Oliver start perusing his diary to himself for a moment. Oliver awakens in his childhood attic, leaps to his knees, and waggles his actual toes triumphantly. He digs through the jewelry box, extracts a massive spatula, and attempts to stash it into his mitten, but it won't fit.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Tommy and Kayleigh place popcorn and drinks on Evan's lap while Lenny pushes his wheelchair as they celebrate Evan's 14th birthday. Evan suddenly experiences a nosebleed, prompting immediate help from Lenny and Kayleigh. Later, sipping from a beer cap, Evan endures pain as he's pushed through dorm rooms, with Kayleigh carrying prosthetic arms. He falls out of the wheelchair amidst a jeering crowd, but Lenny and Kayleigh continue to support him around the quad. Evan, wearing prosthetic arms, looks brighter seeing his friends, but feels heartbroken seeing Lenny with Kayleigh. Later, Evan, fully clothed, lies in a filling bathtub, accepting his fate as water rises. Tommy enters, adjusting Evan's mechanical wheelchair to leave the room. Evan becomes joyful when Lenny shows him his old journal, leading Evan to read it. In a vivid return to his childhood kitchen, Evan triumphantly uses his real hands, unsuccessfully trying to hide a butcher knife in his sock.
